Class Board

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
BoardEvent, Cloneable
public class Board extends Object implements Cloneable, BoardEvent
The definition of a chessboard position and its status. It exposes methods to manipulate the board, evolve the position moving pieces around, revert already performed moves, and retrieve the status of the current configuration on the board. Furthermore, it offers a handy way for loading a position from a Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) string and exporting it in the same format.

Each position in uniquely identified by hashes that could be retrieved using getIncrementalHashKey() and getZobristKey() methods. Also, the implementation supports comparison against other board instances using either the strict (strictEquals(Object)) or the non-strict (equals(Object)) mode.

The board can be observed registering BoardEventListeners for particular types of events. Moreover, the Board class itself is a BoardEvent, and hence it can be passed to the observers of the BoardEventType.ON_LOAD events, emitted when a new chess position is loaded from an external source (e.g. a FEN string).

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructs a new board using a default game context. The board will keep its history updated, that is, will store a hash value for each position encountered.
      See Also:
      • Board(GameContext, boolean)

    • Board

      public Board(GameContext gameContext, boolean updateHistory)
      Constructs a new board, using the game context provided in input. When history updates are enabled, the board will keep the hashes of all positions encountered.
      Parameters:
      gameContext - the game context to use for this board
      updateHistory - whether to keep the history updated or not

  • Method Details

    • doMove

      public boolean doMove(String move)
      Executes a move on the board, specified in Short Algebraic Notation (SAN). It returns true if the operation has been successful and the position changed after the move. It performs a full validation of the board status to assess the outcome of the operation.

      N.B.: the method does not check whether the move is legal or not according to the standard chess rules, but rather if the resulting configuration is valid. For instance, it is totally fine to move the king by two or more squares, or a rook beyond its friendly pieces, as long as the position obtained after the move does not violate any chess constraint.

      Parameters:
      move - the move to execute in SAN notation, such as Nc3
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful and the resulting position is valid

    • doMove

      public boolean doMove(Move move)
      Executes a move on the board without performing a full validation of the position. It returns true if the operation has been successful and the position changed after the move.

      Same as invoking doMove(move, false).

      Parameters:
      move - the move to execute
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful and the resulting position is valid
      See Also:
      • doMove(Move, boolean)

    • doMove

      public boolean doMove(Move move, boolean fullValidation)
      Executes a move on the board. It returns true if the operation has been successful and the position changed after the move. When a full validation is requested, additional checks are performed to assess the outcome of the operation, such as if the side to move is the expected one, if castling or promotion moves are allowed, if the move replaces another piece of the same side, etc.

      N.B.: the method does not check whether the move is legal or not according to the standard chess rules, but rather if the resulting configuration is valid. For instance, it is totally fine to move the king by two or more squares, or a rook beyond its friendly pieces, as long as the position obtained after the move does not violate any chess constraint.

      Parameters:
      move - the move to execute
      fullValidation - whether to perform a full validation of the position or not
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful and the resulting position is valid

    • doNullMove

      public boolean doNullMove()
      Executes a null move on the board. It returns true if the operation has been successful.

      A null move it is a special move that does not change the position of any piece, but simply updates the history of the board and switches the side to move. It could be useful in some scenarios to implement a "passing turn" behavior.

      Returns:
      true if the null move was successful

    • undoMove

      public Move undoMove()
      Reverts the latest move played on the board and returns it. If no moves were previously executed, it returns null.
      Returns:
      the reverted move, or null if no previous moves were played

    • movePiece

      protected Piece movePiece(Move move, MoveBackup backup)
      Moves a piece on the board and updates the backup passed in input. It returns the captured piece, if any, or Piece.NONE otherwise.

      Same as invoking movePiece(move.getFrom(), move.getTo(), move.getPromotion(), backup).

      Parameters:
      move - the move to perform
      backup - the move backup to update
      Returns:
      the captured piece, if present, or Piece.NONE otherwise
      See Also:
      • movePiece(Square, Square, Piece, MoveBackup)

    • movePiece

      protected Piece movePiece(Square from, Square to, Piece promotion, MoveBackup backup)
      Moves a piece on the board and updates the backup passed in input. It returns the captured piece, if any, or Piece.NONE otherwise. The piece movement is described by its starting and destination squares, and by the piece to promote the moving piece to in case of a promotion.
      Parameters:
      from - the starting square of the piece
      to - the destination square of the piece
      promotion - the piece to set on the board to replace the moving piece after its promotion, or Piece.NONE in case the move is not a promotion
      backup - the move backup to update
      Returns:
      the captured piece, if present, or Piece.NONE otherwise

    • undoMovePiece

      protected void undoMovePiece(Move move)
      Reverts the effects of a piece previously moved. It restores the moved piece where it was and cancels any possible promotion to another piece.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to undo

    • hasPiece

      public boolean hasPiece(Piece piece, Square[] location)
      Searches the piece in any of the squares provided in input and returns true if found.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to search in any of the given squares
      location - an array of squares where to look the piece for
      Returns:
      true if the piece is found

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece(Square sq)
      Returns the piece at the specified square, or Piece.NONE if the square is empty.
      Parameters:
      sq - the square to get the piece from
      Returns:
      the found piece, or Piece.NONE if no piece is present on the square

    • getBitboard

      public long getBitboard()
      Returns the bitboard that represents all the pieces on the board, for both sides.
      Returns:
      the bitboard of all the pieces on the board

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the bitboard of the given piece definition

    • getBitboard

      public long getBitboard(Side side)
      Returns the bitboard that represents all the pieces of a given side present on the board.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the bitboard of all the pieces of the side

    • getBbSide

      public long[] getBbSide()
      Returns the bitboards that represents all the pieces present on the board, one for each side. The bitboard for white is stored at index 0, the bitboard for black at index 1.
      Returns:
      the bitboards of all the pieces for both sides

    • getPieceLocation

      public List<Square> getPieceLocation(Piece piece)
      Returns the list of squares that contain all the pieces of a given side and type.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece for which the list of squares must be returned
      Returns:
      the list of squares that contain the given piece definition

    • getFistPieceLocation

      public Square getFistPieceLocation(Piece piece)
      Returns the square of the first piece of a given side and type found on the board, scanning from lower ranks/files. If no piece is found, Square.NONE is returned.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece for which the first encountered square must be returned
      Returns:
      the first square that contain the given piece definition, or Square.NONE if the piece is not found

    • getEnPassantTarget

      public Square getEnPassantTarget()
      Returns the target square of an en passant capture, if any. In other words, the square which contains the pawn that can be captured en passant.
      Returns:
      the en passant target square, or Square.NONE if en passant is not possible
      See Also:
      • getEnPassant()

    • setEnPassantTarget

      public void setEnPassantTarget(Square enPassant)
      Sets the en passant target square.
      Parameters:
      enPassant - the en passant target square to set
      See Also:
      • getEnPassantTarget()

    • getEnPassant

      public Square getEnPassant()
      Returns the destination square of an en passant capture, if any. In other words, the square a pawn will move to in case an enemy pawn is captured en passant.
      Returns:
      the en passant destination square, or Square.NONE if en passant is not possible
      See Also:
      • getEnPassantTarget()

    • setEnPassant

      public void setEnPassant(Square enPassant)

      Parameters:
      enPassant - the en passant destination square to set
      See Also:
      • getEnPassant()

    • getMoveCounter

      public Integer getMoveCounter()
      Returns the counter of full moves played. The counter is incremented after each move played by black.
      Returns:
      the counter of full moves

    • setMoveCounter

      public void setMoveCounter(Integer moveCounter)
      Sets the counter of full moves.
      Parameters:
      moveCounter - the counter of full moves to set
      See Also:
      • getMoveCounter()

    • getHalfMoveCounter

      public Integer getHalfMoveCounter()
      Returns the counter of half moves. The counter is incremented after each capture or pawn move, and it is used to apply the fifty-move rule.
      Returns:
      the counter of half moves

    • setHalfMoveCounter

      public void setHalfMoveCounter(Integer halfMoveCounter)
      Sets the counter of half moves.
      Parameters:
      halfMoveCounter - the counter of half moves to set
      See Also:

      public CastleRight getCastleRight(Side side)
      Returns the castle right of a given side.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the castle right of the side

    • getCastleRight

      public EnumMap<Side,CastleRight> getCastleRight()
      Returns the castle rights for both sides, stored in an EnumMap.
      Returns:
      the map containing the castle rights for both sides

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the entire board and resets its status and all the flags to their default value.

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Piece piece, Square sq)
      Sets a piece on a square.

      The operation does not perform any move, but rather simply puts a piece onto a square.

      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to be placed on the square
      sq - the square the piece has to be set to

    • unsetPiece

      public void unsetPiece(Piece piece, Square sq)
      Unsets a piece from a square.
      Parameters:
      piece - the piece to be removed from the square
      sq - the square the piece has to be unset from

    • loadFromFen

      public void loadFromFen(String fen)
      Loads a specific chess position from a valid Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) string. The status of the current board is replaced with the one of the FEN string (e.g. en passant squares, castle rights, etc.).
      Parameters:
      fen - the FEN string representing the chess position to load

    • getFen

      public String getFen()
      Generates the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) representation of the current position and its status. Full and half moves counters are included in the output.

      Same as invoking getFen(true, false).

      Returns:
      the string that represents the current position in FEN notation
      See Also:
      • getFen(boolean, boolean)

    • getFen

      public String getFen(boolean includeCounters)
      Generates the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) representation of the current position and its status. Full and half moves counters are included in the output if the relative flag is enabled.

      Same as invoking getFen(includeCounters, false).

      Parameters:
      includeCounters - if true, move counters are included in the resulting string
      Returns:
      the string that represents the current position in FEN notation
      See Also:
      • getFen(boolean, boolean)

    • getFen

      public String getFen(boolean includeCounters, boolean onlyOutputEnPassantIfCapturable)
      Generates the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) representation of the current position and its status. Full and half moves counters are included in the output if the relative flag is enabled. Furthermore, it is possible to control whether to include the en passant square in the result only when the pawn can be captured or every time the en passant target exists.
      Parameters:
      includeCounters - if true, move counters are included in the resulting string
      onlyOutputEnPassantIfCapturable - if true, the en passant square is included in the output only if the pawn that just moved can be captured. Otherwise, if false, the en passant square is always included in the output when the en passant target exists
      Returns:
      the string that represents the current position in FEN notation

    • boardToArray

      public Piece[] boardToArray()
      Returns an array of pieces that represents the current position on the board. For each index, the array holds the piece present on the square with the same index, or Piece.NONE if the square is empty.
      Returns:
      the array that contains the pieces on the board

    • getType

      public BoardEventType getType()
      The type of board events this data structure represents when notified to its observers.
      Specified by:
      getType in interface BoardEvent
      Returns:
      the board event type BoardEventType.ON_LOAD

    • getEventListener

      public EnumMap<BoardEventType,List<BoardEventListener>> getEventListener()
      Returns an EnumMap of the event listeners registered to this board. Each entry of the map contains the list of observers for a particular type of events.
      Returns:
      the event listeners registered to this board

    • addEventListener

      public Board addEventListener(BoardEventType eventType, BoardEventListener listener)
      Registers to the board a new listener for a specified event type.

      It returns a reference to this board to fluently chain other calls for registering (or deregistering) other listeners.

      Parameters:
      eventType - the board event type observed by the listener
      listener - the listener to register
      Returns:
      this board

    • removeEventListener

      public Board removeEventListener(BoardEventType eventType, BoardEventListener listener)
      Deregisters from the board a listener for a specified event type.

      It returns a reference to this board to fluently chain other calls for deregistering (or registering) other listeners.

      Parameters:
      eventType - the board event type observed by the listener
      listener - the listener to deregister
      Returns:
      this board

    • squareAttackedBy

      public long squareAttackedBy(Square square, Side side)
      Returns the bitboard representing the pieces of a specific side that can attack the given square.

      Same as invoking squareAttackedBy(square, side, getBitboard()).

      Parameters:
      square - the target square
      side - the attacking side
      Returns:
      the bitboard of all the pieces of the given side that can attack the square
      See Also:
      • squareAttackedBy(Square, Side, long)

    • squareAttackedBy

      public long squareAttackedBy(Square square, Side side, long occ)
      Returns the bitboard representing the pieces of a specific side that can attack the given square. It takes a bitboard mask in input to filter the result for a specific set of occupied squares only.
      Parameters:
      square - the target square
      side - the attacking side
      occ - a mask of occupied squares
      Returns:
      the bitboard of all the pieces of the given side that can attack the square

    • squareAttackedByPieceType

      Parameters:

      side - the attacking side
      type - the type of the attacking pieces
      Returns:

      Returns:

    • isKingAttacked

      public boolean isKingAttacked()
      Checks if the king of the side to move is attacked by any enemy piece.
      Returns:
      true if the king of the next side to move is attacked

    • isSquareAttackedBy

      public boolean isSquareAttackedBy(List<Square> squares, Side side)
      Checks if any of the squares provided in input is attacked by the given side in the current position.
      Parameters:
      squares - the target squares
      side - the attacking side
      Returns:
      true if any square is attacked

    • isMoveLegal

      public boolean isMoveLegal(Move move, boolean fullValidation)
      Verifies if the move still to be executed will leave the resulting board in a valid (legal) position. Optionally, it can perform a full validation, a stricter check to assess if the final board configuration could be considered valid or not.

      The full validation checks:

      • if a piece is actually moving;
      • if the moving side is the next side to move in the position;
      • if the destination square does not contain a piece of the same side of the moving one;
      • in case of a promotion, if a promoting piece is present;
      • in case of castling, if the castle move can be performed.
      N.B.: the method does not check whether the move is legal or not according to the standard chess rules, but only if the resulting configuration is valid. For instance, it is considered valid moving the king by two or more squares, or a rook beyond its friendly pieces, as long as the position obtained after the move does not violate any chess constraint.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to validate
      fullValidation - performs a full validation of the move
      Returns:
      true if the move is considered valid

    • isAttackedBy

      public boolean isAttackedBy(Move move)
      Checks if the squares of a move are consistent, that is, if the destination square is attacked by the piece placed on the starting square.
      Parameters:
      move - the move to check
      Returns:
      true if the move is coherent

    • getHistory

      public LinkedList<Long> getHistory()
      Returns the history of the board, represented by the hashes of all the positions occurred on the board.
      Returns:
      the list of hashes of all the positions occurred on the board
      See Also:
      • getIncrementalHashKey()

    • isMated

      public boolean isMated()
      Verifies in the current position if the king of the side to move is mated.
      Returns:
      true if the king of the side to move is checkmated

    • isDraw

      public boolean isDraw()
      Verifies if the current position is a forced draw because any of the standard chess rules. Specifically, the method checks for:
      • threefold repetition;
      • insufficient material;
      • fifty-move rule;
      • stalemate.
      Returns:
      true if the position is a draw

    • isRepetition

      public boolean isRepetition(int n)
      Verifies if the current position has been repeated at least n times, where n is provided in input.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of repetitions to check in the position
      Returns:
      true if the position has been repeated at least n times

    • isRepetition

      public boolean isRepetition()
      Verifies if the current position has been repeated at least three times (threefold repetition).

      Same as invoking isRepetition(3).

      Returns:
      true if the position has been repeated at least three times
      See Also:
      • isRepetition(int)

    • isInsufficientMaterial

      public boolean isInsufficientMaterial()
      Verifies if the current position has insufficient material to continue the game, and thus it must be considered a forced draw.
      Returns:
      true if the position has insufficient material

    • isStaleMate

      public boolean isStaleMate()
      Verifies in the current position if the king of the side to move is stalemated, and thus if the position must be considered a forced draw.
      Returns:
      true if the king of the side to move is stalemated

    • isEnableEvents

      public boolean isEnableEvents()
      Returns whether the notifications of board events are enabled or not.
      Returns:
      true if board events are notified to observers

    • setEnableEvents

      public void setEnableEvents(boolean enableEvents)
      Sets the flag that controls the notification of board events. If true, board events are emitted, otherwise they are turned off.
      Parameters:
      enableEvents - whether the notification of board events is enabled or not

    • getPositionId

      public String getPositionId()
      Returns the unique position ID for the current position and status. The identifier is nothing more than the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) representation of the board without the move counters.

      Although this is a reliable way for identifying a unique position, it is much slower than using hashCode() or getZobristKey().

      Returns:
      the unique position ID
      See Also:
      • hashCode()
      • getZobristKey()

    • legalMoves

      public List<Move> legalMoves()
      Returns the list of all possible legal moves for the current position according to the standard rules of chess. If such moves are played, it is guaranteed the resulting position will also be legal.
      Returns:
      the list of legal moves available in the current position

    • pseudoLegalMoves

      public List<Move> pseudoLegalMoves()
      Returns the list of all possible pseudo-legal moves for the current position.

      A move is considered pseudo-legal when it is legal according to the standard rules of chess piece movements, but the resulting position might not be legal because of other rules (e.g. checks to the king).

      Returns:
      the list of pseudo-legal moves available in the current position

    • pseudoLegalCaptures

      public List<Move> pseudoLegalCaptures()
      Returns the list of all possible pseudo-legal captures for the current position.

      A move is considered a pseudo-legal capture when it takes an enemy piece and it is legal according to the standard rules of chess piece movements, but the resulting position might not be legal because of other rules (e.g. checks to the king).

      Returns:
      the list of pseudo-legal captures available in the current position

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks if this board is equivalent to another.

      Two boards are considered equivalent when:

      • the pieces are the same, placed on the very same squares;
      • the side to move is the same;
      • the castling rights are the same;
      • the en passant target is the same.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the other object reference to compare to this board
      Returns:
      true if this board and the object reference are equivalent
      See Also:
      • strictEquals(Object)

    • strictEquals

      public boolean strictEquals(Object obj)
      Checks if this board is equivalent to another performing a strict comparison.

      Two boards are considered strictly equivalent when:

      • they are equivalent;
      • their history is the same.
      Parameters:
      obj - the other object reference to compare to this board
      Returns:
      true if this board and the object reference are strictly equivalent
      See Also:
      • equals(Object)

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for this board.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      a hash value for this board

    • getZobristKey

      public long getZobristKey()
      Returns a Zobrist hash code value for this board. A Zobrist hashing assures the same position returns the same hash value. It is calculated using the position of the pieces, the side to move, the castle rights and the en passant target.
      Returns:
      a Zobrist hash value for this board
      See Also:
      • Zobrist hashing in Wikipedia

    • toStringFromWhiteViewPoint

      public String toStringFromWhiteViewPoint()
      Returns a human-readable representation of the board taking the perspective of white, with the 1st rank at the bottom and the 8th rank at the top.

      Same as invoking toStringFromViewPoint(Side.WHITE).

      Returns:
      a string representation of the board from white player's point of view
      See Also:
      • toStringFromViewPoint(Side)

    • toStringFromBlackViewPoint

      public String toStringFromBlackViewPoint()
      Returns a human-readable representation of the board taking the perspective of black, with the 8th rank at the bottom and the 1st rank at the top.

      Same as invoking toStringFromViewPoint(Side.BLACK).

      Returns:
      a string representation of the board from black player's point of view
      See Also:
      • toStringFromViewPoint(Side)

    • toStringFromViewPoint

      public String toStringFromViewPoint(Side side)
      Returns a human-readable representation of the board taking the perspective of one side, with the 1st rank at the bottom in case of white, or the 8th rank at the bottom in case of black.
      Parameters:
      side - the side whose home rank should be at the bottom of the resulting representation
      Returns:
      a string representation of the board using one of the two player's point of view

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this board.

      The result of toStringFromWhiteViewPoint() is used to print the position of the board.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the board
      See Also:
      • toStringFromWhiteViewPoint()

    • clone

      public Board clone()
      Returns a reference to a copy of the board. The board history is copied as well.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a copy of the board

    • getIncrementalHashKey

      public long getIncrementalHashKey()
      Returns the current incremental hash key. This hash value changes every time the position changes, hence it is unique for every position.
      Returns:
      the current incremental hash key

    • setIncrementalHashKey

      public void setIncrementalHashKey(long hashKey)
      Sets the current incremental hash key, replacing the previous one.
      Parameters:
      hashKey - the incremental hash key to set
